blocks.content: DoS (Denial of Service) is an attack where a single system sends a large amount of traffic or requests to a target to overload it. In naval style, it is like one enemy ship blocking a narrow sea path to stop your ship from moving forward.

DDoS (Distributed Denial of Service) is a larger version of DoS. Many systems attack the target at the same time. In naval style, it is like many enemy ships blocking your path at once, making movement impossible.
The goal is to flood the target with more requests than it can handle. When the target cannot manage the load, it stops responding to real users.

content: Crashes services or slows them down
